section.title: Vehicle features and options
section.paragraph: This chapter describes model-specific equipment, systems and functions that are available now and will be available in the future, even if they are not available in the owned vehicle.
Additional information:
Vehicle equipment.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: The onboard vehicle tool kit is located under the cargo area floor.

overview.overview-text: Do not fold in or switch on wipers without wiper blades

warning.paragraph: NOTICE

The window may sustain damage if the wiper falls onto it without the wiper blade installed. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Hold the wiper firmly when changing the wiper blade. Do not fold in or switch on the wiper without a wiper blade installed.

overview.overview-text: Fold in wipers before opening the hood

warning.paragraph: NOTICE

Folded-out wipers can be jammed when the hood is opened. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Make sure that the wipers with the wiper blades mounted are folded down onto the windshield before opening the hood.

action-step.paragraph: To change the wiper blades, bring wipers into fold-out position.
Fold-out position of the wipers.
Fold out and hold the wiper arm firmly.
Squeeze the retaining spring, arrow 1, and fold up the wiper blade, arrow 2.
Remove the wiper blade forward from the detent.
Insert the new wiper blade in reverse order of removal until it locks in place.
Fold in the wipers.
To change the wiper blades, bring wipers into fold-out position.
Fold-out position of the wipers.
Lift the wiper off of the windshield and hold.
Press the button, arrow 1, turn the wiper blade slightly clockwise, and pull it forward and out, arrow 2.
The wiper arm has connections for window wiper fluid and heating. Insert the connections correctly into the new wiper blade

Insert the new wiper blade and press it on until it you hear it snap into the holder. The wiper arm has connections for window wiper fluid and heating. When inserting, make sure that the connections are inserted into the wiper blade correctly.
Fold in the wipers.

section.title: Replacing the rear wiper blade
section.paragraph: The wiper blade is engaged at the end of the wiper arm.

action-step.paragraph: Push the lever down, arrow 1, and pull off wiper blade, arrow 2.
Attach a new wiper blade. The wiper blade must engage audibly.
Lift off the wiper fully and pull off the wiper blade, arrow.
Attach a new wiper blade. The wiper blade must engage audibly.
Fold in the wipers.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Lights and bulbs make an essential contribution to driving safety.
All headlights and lights are designed using LED technology at least.
Some items of equipment use light-emitting diodes installed behind a cover as a light source. These light-emitting diodes are designated Class 1 light-emitting diodes.
The manufacturer of the vehicle recommends that you let an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop perform the work in case of a malfunction.

overview.overview-text: Do not perform any work on the lighting system

warning.paragraph: Warning

Focused laser light can irritate or permanently damage the retina of the eye. There is a risk of injury. The manufacturer of the vehicle recommends that the work on the lighting system including bulb exchange be performed by an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

overview.overview-text: Do not look into light sources

warning.paragraph: Warning
Intense brightness can irritate or damage the retina of the eye. There is a risk of injury. Do not look directly into the headlights or other light sources. Do not remove the LED covers.

section.title: Headlight glass
section.paragraph: The inside of the headlight glass can fog up in cool or humid weather. When driving with the lights switched on, the condensation evaporates after a short time. The headlight glass does not need to be changed.
If, despite driving with the headlights switched on, moisture such as water droplets increasingly forms in the light, have the headlights checked.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: In addition to the high-voltage battery, the vehicle has a 12 volt vehicle battery. The vehicle battery supplies the onboard electronics with energy.
The battery is maintenance-free.
More information about the battery can be requested from an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.
For more information about the battery inspection, refer to the Service Manual included in the delivery.
The specified service life can only be guaranteed when the battery is recharged in regular intervals. Check the battery charge state regularly when making frequent short-distance drives.

warning.paragraph: DANGER
Contact with live components can lead to an electric shock. There is a risk of injury or danger to life. Do not touch any components that are under voltage.
Warning

Vehicle batteries that are classified as not suitable can damage vehicle systems and impair vehicle functions. There is a risk of injury or risk of damage to property. Only use vehicle batteries that the vehicle manufacturer has classified as suitable.

Vehicle batteries that are not compatible can damage vehicle systems and impair vehicle functions. There is a risk of an accident and damage to property. Only vehicle batteries that are compatible with your vehicle type should be installed in your vehicle. Information on compatible vehicle batteries is available at an authorized service center.

overview.overview-text: In case of discharged vehicle battery, contact your service center

warning.paragraph: NOTICE

Battery chargers that charge the vehicle battery via sockets or cigarette lighters in the vehicle may overload or damage the 12 V electrical system. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. In the case of a discharged vehicle battery, contact an authorized service center or other qualified service center or repair shop.

section.title: Registering the battery to the vehicle
section.paragraph: The manufacturer of the vehicle recommends that you have an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop register the vehicle battery to the vehicle after the battery has been changed. Once the battery has been registered again, all comfort features will be available without limitation and any Check Control messages displayed which relate to comfort features will disappear.

section.title: Hazard icons
section.paragraph: The following hazard icons can be found on the vehicle battery:

entry.paragraph: No smoking, no naked flames, no sparks.
Risk of chemical burn: wear gloves, do not tilt battery.
Flush acid splashes with water immediately. In the event of contact with the eyes or swallowing, seek a physician immediately.
Explosive gas mixture. Do not close any openings of the battery.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The vehicle manufacturer recommends to have the vehicle battery exclusively replaced by an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop. An improper change does not ensure that the vehicle recognizes the battery correctly and that the proper function is ensured.

section.title: Information on removal
section.paragraph: Follow the information on removing the vehicle battery:

item.paragraph: Switch off the vehicle and electrical components.
First, disconnect the power connection from the negative terminal. Next, disconnect the power connection from the positive terminal.

section.title: Information on installation
section.paragraph: Follow the information on installing the vehicle battery:

item.paragraph: If necessary, remove foreign bodies from the battery bracket.
Install the battery only at the position provided for this purpose in the vehicle.
Keep the contacts of the battery and vehicle connections clean.
First, connect the power connection on the positive terminal. Next, connect the power connection on the negative terminal.
Use existing connections, connectors and covers.
If necessary, connect the gas outlet with the hose.

section.title: Commissioning
section.paragraph: The battery is ready for operation. Special precautions for commissioning are not required.

section.title: Charging the battery
section.paragraph: A charger that is installed in the vehicle supplies the vehicle battery with power. The charger receives the necessary energy from the high-voltage battery.
Additional information:
Charge vehicle.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Make sure that the battery is always sufficiently charged to guarantee that the battery remains usable for its full service life.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: A discharged battery is indicated by a red indicator light.

section.paragraph: Charge the battery when acceleration is insufficient.
Charge the battery in the following situations:

item.paragraph: When the inspection glass on the top of the battery is black.
When the take-off performance is insufficient.

section.paragraph: The following circumstances can have a negative effect on the performance of the battery:

item.paragraph: Frequent short-distance drives.
Stationary periods of more than one month.

warning.paragraph: Warning

If the battery is charged with a yellow color indicator on the top side, it may burst (explode). There is a risk of injury or risk of damage to property. For vehicles with a battery inspection indicator, always check the color indicator on the top side of the battery before charging. When the indicator is yellow, a battery replacement is required.
Do not charge vehicles without a battery inspection indicator with an electrical voltage of more than 14.8 V.
Warning

Applied voltage may cause short circuits when working on the vehicle electronics. There is a risk of fire and an injury hazard. When working on the vehicle electronics, disconnect the cable connection on the negative terminal of the battery.
NOTICE
The distance while the engine is running may cause an overvoltage. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Do not remove when the engine is running.

overview.overview-text: Do not connect battery chargers to the sockets in the vehicle

warning.paragraph: NOTICE

Battery chargers that charge the vehicle battery via sockets or cigarette lighters in the vehicle may overload or damage the 12 V electrical system. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Only connect battery chargers for the vehicle battery to the jump-start terminals in the engine compartment.

section.title: Battery charger
section.paragraph: Special battery chargers designed for the vehicle and compatible with the vehicle electrical system are available from an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

section.title: Charging the battery
section.paragraph: Charge the battery only when the engine is off and via the jump-start terminals in the engine compartment.
With Mild Hybrid technology: charge the battery only when the hood is opened.
Additional information:
Jump-start terminals.

section.title: Power interruption
section.paragraph: After a power interruption, some equipment needs to be newly initialized or individual settings updated, for example:

item.paragraph: Parking brake.
With Memory function: store the positions again.
Time: update.
Date: update.
Glass sunroof: initialize the system.

section.title: Storing the battery
section.paragraph: Pay attention to the following for storing vehicle batteries:

item.paragraph: Store the battery in a cool and dry location.
Protect the battery from direct sunlight or frost.
Use only a damp, anti-static cloth to clean the battery.
Store the battery upright and secure it to prevent tipping over.
Install the oldest batteries first.
Do not remove the protective cap from the contacts.
Charge or install the battery no later than on the date on the battery label. After a complete charge, the battery remains functional for another 10 months.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: Part of the Mild Hybrid technology is a battery that works with a voltage of 48 volts. Mild Hybrid technology can lower the fuel consumption.

warning.paragraph: DANGER
Contact with live components can lead to an electric shock. There is a risk of injury or danger to life. Do not touch any components that are under voltage.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: The battery for the Mild-Hybrid technology is located under a cover in the engine compartment on the front passenger side.

action-step.paragraph: Turn lid up to the opened lock symbolarrow 1.
Remove cover, arrow 2.

section.title: Notice
section.paragraph: Do not exchange or work on the battery for the Mild Hybrid technology.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Have old batteries disposed of by an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop or take them to a collection point.
Maintain the filled battery in an upright position for transport and storage. Secure the battery so that it does not tip over during transport.
Transport the filled batteries in an upright position. Secure the battery so that it does not tip over during transport.
Consult a specialized shop regarding the disposal of old batteries.

Because the inside is filled with battery fluid, it must be ensured that the battery is upright during transport or when stored and the side with the terminal clip faces up. The battery must be secured to prevent tilting during transport.

section.title: Warranty
section.paragraph: For information about the warranty of the battery, refer to the sales contract for the vehicle.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The fuses are located at different places in the vehicle.
Information on the fuse layout and the positions of the fuse boxes is available on the Internet: fusecard.bmw.com.

warning.paragraph: Warning

Incorrect or repaired fuses can overload electrical lines and components. There is a risk of fire. Never attempt to repair a blown fuse and do not replace a nonworking fuse with a fuse of another color or ampere rating.

Incorrect and repaired fuses can overload electrical lines and components. There is a risk of fire. Never attempt to repair a blown fuse. Do not replace a nonworking fuse with a substitute of another color or amperage rating.

section.title: Replacing fuses
section.paragraph: The vehicle manufacturer recommends that you have an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop replace the fuses.
